WITH ins AS (
  INSERT INTO submissions (
    form_id, source_id, resource, received_at,
    raw_payload, email, full_name, message, external_id, status
  )
  VALUES (
    (SELECT id FROM forms   WHERE code = $1),
    (SELECT id FROM sources WHERE code = $2),
    $2,
    NOW(),
    $3::jsonb,
    $4, $5, $6, $7,
    'new'
  )
  ON CONFLICT (external_id) DO UPDATE
    SET external_id = EXCLUDED.external_id  -- no-op –¥–ª—è –∏–¥–µ–º–ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏
  RETURNING id
)
SELECT id AS submission_id FROM ins
UNION ALL
SELECT id FROM submissions WHERE external_id = $7
LIMIT 1;

UPDATE submissions 
SET 
  is_spam = TRUE, 
  status = 'archived', 
  spam_score = {{ $('1e. Validate & Shape').item.json.classification.confidence }}, 
  spam_reason = 'AI Classification'
WHERE 
  id = '{{ $('2. Insert Submission').item.json.submission_id }}';

values.content:
=You are an information extractor. Return ONLY valid minified JSON. No comments, no prose.

Intake context:
- trigger = {{ $json.trigger }}
- source_code = {{ $json.source_code }}
- form_code = {{ $json.form_code }}

***Intake policy (VERY IMPORTANT):***
This pipeline is for CLIENT requests only. Allowed intents: ["client","partner","newsletter"].
If you detect a candidate/job-seeker/Resume/CV/looking for a job, then this is NOT a valid intake here.
In such case, set:
  classification.label = "spam"
  classification.intent = "generic"
  and add "candidate_on_client_intake" to tags.

Normalize and extract fields for CRM ingestion. If unsure, use null or [].
Input envelope (JSON):
{{ JSON.stringify($json.ai_view, null, 2) }}

Return JSON with this exact structure:
{
 "classification": {
   "label": "spam|ham",
   "intent": "client|candidate|partner|newsletter|generic",
   "confidence": 0.0
 },
 "contact": {
   "email": "...", "full_name": "...", "phone_numbers":[{"number":"...","label":"..."}],
   "title": "...", "timezone":"...", "preferred_lang":"en|pl|ru|uk|..."
 },
 "company": { "name":"...", "website":"https://...", "country":"..." },
 "message": { "plain":"...", "html":"...", "subject":"...", "sent_at":"ISO8601" },
 "project": {
   "description":"...", "budget":{"amount":12345,"currency":"USD|EUR|PLN"},
   "timeline":{"start":"ISO8601|null","deadline":"ISO8601|null","urgency":"low|med|high"},
   "stack":{"frontend":[],"backend":[],"blockchain":[],"ai":[]},
   "links":[]
 },
 "candidate_profile": {
   "cv_url":"...", "skills":[], "experience_years":0.0, "location":"...",
   "rate_currency":"USD|EUR|PLN", "rate_min":0, "rate_max":0, "rate_period":"hourly|daily|monthly",
   "availability":"available_now|part_time|notice_period|unavailable"
 },
 "newsletter": { "subscribe": false, "unsubscribe": false },
 "tags": [],
 "external": { "message_id":"...", "dedupe_key":"..." },
 "shortSummaryForSales":"..."
}
Rules:
- classification.intent MUST be one of allowed intents above for ham.
- Prefer contact.email from envelope; fallback to parsed addresses in text if present.
- company.name from corporate domain if not given (strip TLD), website=https://<domain>.
- message.sent_at must be ISO8601; if numeric timestamp, convert to ISO string.
- budget currency ONLY: USD/EUR/PLN. If other, map to nearest or null.
- preferred_lang ISO-639-1 if guessable (en/pl/ru/uk); else null.
- tags: short keywords like ["budget","timeline","solidity"].
- Never invent personal data; keep null when unsure.

WITH ins AS (
  INSERT INTO companies (name, website)
  SELECT $1, $2
  -- –í–∞–∂–Ω–æ: ON CONFLICT —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–æ –ø–æ–ª—é website!
  ON CONFLICT (website) DO UPDATE
  SET
    -- –ï—Å–ª–∏ —É —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–µ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏–º—è –±—ã–ª–æ –ø—É—Å—Ç–æ–µ, –∞ —É –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –µ—Å—Ç—å, –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–∏–º –µ–≥–æ
    name = COALESCE(companies.name, EXCLUDED.name),
    updated_at = NOW()
  RETURNING id
)
SELECT id AS company_id FROM ins
UNION ALL
-- –≠—Ç–æ—Ç SELECT –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å ID, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —Å—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª DO UPDATE
SELECT id FROM companies WHERE website = $2
LIMIT 1;

INSERT INTO companies (name)
SELECT $1
WHERE $1 IS NOT NULL
RETURNING id AS company_id;

SELECT c.id AS contact_id
FROM contacts c
JOIN contact_emails ce ON c.id = ce.contact_id
WHERE lower(ce.email) = lower($1)
LIMIT 1;

UPDATE contacts
SET
  full_name = COALESCE($1, full_name),
  company_id = COALESCE($2, company_id),
  updated_at = NOW()
WHERE id = $3
RETURNING id AS contact_id;

INSERT INTO contact_emails (contact_id, email, is_primary)
VALUES ($1, $2, TRUE);

INSERT INTO leads (contact_id, company_id, type, stage, source_id, dedupe_key)
VALUES (
  $1,
  $2,
  $3::lead_type,                      -- 'client' | 'partner' | 'newsletter'
  'new',
  (SELECT id FROM sources WHERE code = $4),
  $5
)
ON CONFLICT (dedupe_key) DO UPDATE SET
  updated_at = NOW()
RETURNING id AS lead_id;

INSERT INTO conversations (lead_id, channel, subject, started_at, last_message_at)
SELECT
  $1, $2::channel, $3, $4::timestamptz, $4::timestamptz
WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM conversations WHERE lead_id=$1)
RETURNING id AS conversation_id;

INSERT INTO messages (
  conversation_id, direction, medium, sender_contact_id,
  body, body_html, message_ts, external_message_id, meta
)
VALUES (
  (SELECT id FROM conversations WHERE lead_id=$1 LIMIT 1),
  'inbound',
  $2::channel,
  $3,
  $4,
  $5,
  $6::timestamptz,
  $7,            -- —Ç—É—Ç —É–∂–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç submission_id –¥–ª—è —Ñ–æ—Ä–º, –∏ Message-ID –¥–ª—è Gmail
  $8::jsonb
)
ON CONFLICT (external_message_id) DO NOTHING
RETURNING id AS message_id;
